Subsection.Text: Subject to section 135 of this Schedule, every multi-purpose passenger vehicle, truck and bus shall conform to the requirements of Technical Standards Document No. 105, Hydraulic and Electric Brake Systems (TSD 105), as amended from time to time.
Despite S5.3 and S5.3.5(b) of TSD 105, if a common indicator is used, the indicator shall display the symbol referred to in subsection 101(9) of this Schedule for brake system malfunction.
Despite S5.3 of TSD 105, the words required to be displayed under S5.3.5 of TSD 105

Paragraph.Text: in the cases referred to in S5.3.5(c)(1)(A), (B) and (D) of TSD 105, may be replaced or accompanied by a symbol that conforms to the colour requirements of subsection 101(9.1) of this Schedule; and
shall be displayed in both official languages, if not accompanied by a symbol.

Subsection.Text: Despite S5.3 and S5.3.5(c)(1)(C) of TSD 105, if a separate indicator is used to indicate a malfunction in an antilock brake system, the indicator shall display the corresponding symbol shown in Table II to section 101 of this Schedule.
The statement set out in S5.4.3 of TSD 105 may be replaced by another statement to the same effect.
